title: What is the best brand of used upright piano? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends on your budget, but I've found that Baldwins really tend to age well if treated with a modicum of respect. In my experience Wurlitzers sound like shoeboxes after 25 years. Story & Clarke are hit and miss. Steinway is usually a good safe bet because the original owner most likely pampered it for many years, and likely did the next owners.

Brand does not matter. Find one that has survived from the 70's or so. Often you can get one off craigslist cheap. Get it home and have it tuned by a pro. Pass it on to the next person when you are done.
